page.title: 02Housing in Stanton-in-Peak
page.content: Stanton, mentioned in the first Domesday Survey, has benefitted from the patronage of the families of Stanton Hall, who in the l800s built the Church, school, reading room and many estate workers cottages from locally quarried gritstone.... 'Our house was once the butcher's shop.In my garden I have dug up lots of bones and teeth of sheep and cows. The big gritstone salting slab from the pantry, is now our garden seat. The old apple loft is a bedroom...' 'My house, 'Brae Cottage' (1985) is the newest house in Stanton. It had to be built of natural gritstone, have a solid wooden front door, a low level roof and windows of a certain size. Outwardly it blends in perfectly with the old houses and is very modern inside. My dad,who is an architect, designed it.'
